subject: Re: [junit] EJB Support [WatchDog checked]
msgSnippet: I am using Junit 3.5 with JBuilder5 enterprise and appserver. I have not found it harder than any other EJB application: its hard to write HelloWorld , but
messageBody:
I am using Junit 3.5 with JBuilder5 enterprise and appserver.

I have not found it harder than any other EJB application: its hard to write
"HelloWorld", but after that the development proceeds smoothly.

One issue is time: you need a fast machine if you want the tests to run quickly.

Phil Rice






Darian Shimy <dshimy@volumebuy.com> on 10/09/2001 16:52:52

Please respond to junit@yahoogroups.com

To: junit@yahoogroups.com
cc: (bcc: Phil S Rice/Magnox/Berkeley/BNFL)
Fax to:
Subject: [junit] EJB Support [WatchDog checked]



Is it possible to test a EJB using Junit? Ideally, I would like to test
within a EJB container.
